text: The face, being the most crucial aspect of the human body, plays a pivotal role in recognizing individuals due to its unique characteristics. Facial recognition technology (FRT) stands out as one of the most remarkable and successful technological advancements of contemporary times. With the advent of the COVID-19 pandemic, there has been a notable shift towards contactless FRT solutions. Owing to its contactless biometric capabilities, FRT has garnered widespread popularity on a global scale. Businesses worldwide are increasingly adopting artificial intelligence-powered FRT systems, thereby unlocking vast commercial opportunities. Key sectors such as security and surveillance, authentication/access control systems, digital healthcare, and photo retrieval have witnessed a significant reliance on FRT technology. In this communication, we provide an overview of the global adoption of FRT, its burgeoning market trends, its diverse applications across various sectors, as well as the challenges and emerging concerns associated with its implementation, with a special focus on both India and the global landscape.
